This project is showcase of a conversation bot using a combination of Watson Conversation and Watson Discovery.

It is based on [Angular2 Express Starter](https://github.com/vladotesanovic/angular2-express-starter) and [the Conversation with Discovery starter app on developer cloud](https://github.com/watson-developer-cloud/conversation-with-discovery)

It uses the following technologies
- Angular 2 ( 2.1 release )
- ExpressJS ( 4.x - with compression )
- Webpack ( [angular-cli](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli) )
- Redux ( NgRx/Store - with server calls)
- [bootstrap 4](https://v4-alpha.getbootstrap.com/getting-started/introduction/)
- [IBM Watson](https://console.bluemix.net/catalog/?taxonomyNavigation=watson&env_id=ibm:yp:us-south&category=watson)

<img width="150" src="https://i.cloudup.com/zfY6lL7eFa-3000x3000.png" />
<img width="50" src="https://angular.io/assets/images/logos/angular/angular.svg" />

# Install / Development

```bash
git clone https://github.com/pdestrais/Watson-conversation-with-discovery-using-angular-and-NodeJS
cd Watson-conversation-with-discovery-using-angular-and-NodeJS
```
# Install dependencies
```bash 
npm install
```

# start server
```bash 
npm run start
```
>**Note:** Client url: http://localhost:4200

>**Note:** Application ( epxress ) API: http://localhost:4300

# configure watson services
The Watson services credentials, workspace id, collection ids, ... are hardcoded into server/routes.api.ts.
This should be externalized (this is a remaining todo)

## Build / Production

```bash
npm run build
```

>**Note:** The nodeJS server can be started on bluemix using the following command : ```node ./dist/server/bin/www.js```
The ```./dist/``` directory must be first copied to the bluemix server using the appropriate cf commands.


## Deploy dist folder to app server

Structure of dist folder:

- /dist/server <-- expressjs
- /dist/client <-- angular2

## Deploy to bluemix
From project root, go to dist directory, log on to bluemix (enter when prompted your Bluemix userid/password and organisation, then push the application to nodeJS application you defined in Bluemix to host the code.


```bash
cd dist
cf login 
cf push [Bluemix application name - example : Conversation-with-discovery-angular]
```

>**Note:** after the push command, the process sometimes hangs on the "starting app ..." phase. Log into bluemix and try to restart manually the server.
